Posts.Content: On 10/15/2009 Maryann1128 wrote: I have been given different answers to this question.  I believe that since everything is gone, a mammogram is not needed.  My surgeon says to get one but I feel they just want to cover themselves.  It is upsetting to me to even think about going to a center, explaining I had breast cancer, and knowing the technician may not know how to react. I appreciate your support and feedback :) Firstly I would not give mammography the time of day!   Secondly, I would insist on MRI screening because you will still have a residual risk and MRI is far  more likey to detect abnormalities and is less harmful than mammography which is only 80% effective, at best.
Posts.Title: Mammogram after bilat mast?

Posts.Content: I have numbness in my feet more than 2 years after the end of treatment.  It may never go away ...
Posts.Title: Nerve damage from Chemo
